en.purpose: To predict probability of hydronephrosis on renal ultrasonography (RUS) requiring urologic intervention.
en.use:
Can be used in adult patients with acute kidney injury.
Variables: 
- History of hydronephrosis: Yes= high risk group, No=-
- Race: Non-black=1, Black=0
- History of recurrent urinary tract infections: Yes=1, No=0
- Diagnosis consistent with possible obstruction: Yes=1, No=0
History of congestive heart failure: No=1, Yes=0
- History of sepsis or prerenal acute kidney injury, use of pressors, or hypotension: No=1, Yes=0
- Exposure to nephrotoxic medications- prior to acute kidney injury: No=1, Yes=0

Formula:  Addition of the selected variables.

Licurse Score         Risk group              Risk of hydronephrosis on imaging             Risk of hydronephrosis requiring stent or nephrostomy tube placement

â‰¤2                            Low                          4.0%                                                                  1.1%

3                               Medium                   6.8%                                                                  0.5%*

>3                             High                         20.9%                                                                4.9%

other_details.references:
1. Licurse A, Kim MC, Dziura J, et al. Renal ultrasonography in the evaluation of acute kidney injury: developing a risk stratification framework. Arch Intern Med. 2010;170(21):1900-7.
2. Ip IK, Silveira PC, Alper EC, Benson CB, Khorasani R. External validation of risk stratification strategy in the use of renal ultrasonography in the evaluation of acute kidney injury. J Hosp Med. 2016;11(11):763-767.

when: $gt0008|History of sepsis or prerenal acute kidney injury, use of pressors, or hypotension|!=null
$gt0009|Exposure to nephrotoxic medications- prior to acute kidney injury|!=null

then: $gt0014|Risk of hydronephrosis requiring stent or nephrostomy tube placement|='1.1%'
$gt0014|Risk of hydronephrosis requiring stent or nephrostomy tube placement|='0.5%'
$gt0014|Risk of hydronephrosis requiring stent or nephrostomy tube placement|='4.9%'

gt0003.description: Documented history of HN in the medical record or any imaging history of HN in the 2 years prior to the current RUS.

gt0005.text: History of recurrent urinary tract infections

gt0006.description: e.g. benign prostatic hyperplasia, abdominal or pelvic cancer, neurogenic bladder, single functional kidney, or previous pelvic surgery.

gt0008.text: History of sepsis or prerenal acute kidney injury, use of pressors, or hypotension

gt0009.text: Exposure to nephrotoxic medications- prior to acute kidney injury
gt0009.description: Aspirin (>81 mg/day), diuretic, ACE inhibitor, or IV vancomycin.

gt0014.text: Risk of hydronephrosis requiring stent or nephrostomy tube placement
